summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of a BOP Captain from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the supervision and circumstances surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The Captain details Epstein's housing status, manipulative behavior, the July 23 incident, and the failures in protocol on August 9-10, 2019, that led to Epstein being found unresponsive without a cellmate.

connections.description: The Captain was responsible for the security and housing protocols for inmate Epstein at MCC.
The Captain reported to and received directives from the Warden regarding Epstein's housing requirements.
The Captain directly supervised the SHU Lieutenant and instructed him repeatedly that Epstein must have a cellmate.
Inmate was selected, vetted, and housed as Epstein's cellmate in the SHU after the July incident.
Lieutenant relieved Lieutenant on the evening shift of August 9, 2019; there was a failure in communication about Epstein's cellmate requirement.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell with a homemade piece of fabric on his chest. His cellmate flagged staff. Epstein later claimed his cellmate tried to kill him.

events.title: Epstein Left Without Cellmate
events.description: Epstein's cellmate, Inmate, had court and was released. Epstein was in an attorney session. Staff failed to reassign a cellmate or notify supervisors, leaving Epstein alone in his cell.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 7:00 AM. He did not have a cellmate. Staff admitted to not completing 30-minute rounds or the 3:00 AM and 5:00 AM counts.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: The BOP Captain was interviewed by FBI and OIG special agents regarding the supervision and circumstances leading to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
FBI New York Field Office, 290 Broadway, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein engaged in manipulative behavior to avoid having a cellmate, including requesting psychological evaluations to get placed on Suicide Watch.
On July 23, 2019, Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell; he later claimed his cellmate tried to kill him, leading to his placement back on Suicide Watch.
The Warden issued a directive that Epstein must have a cellmate at all times, which was verbally communicated by the Captain to his Lieutenants but not formally documented.

On August 9-10, 2019, protocol failures occurred: Epstein's cellmate was released, no new cellmate was assigned, 30-minute rounds and inmate counts were not completed, and SHU cameras were non-functional.
Correctional Officers Thomas and Noel admitted to entering Epstein's cell without supervision and failing to complete required rounds and counts on the night of his death.
